authorsByline: Caitlin Shuda, Wisconsin Rapids Daily Tribune
title: Craving Chick-fil-A? You can find the Tri-State Food Truck Aug. 14 in Wisconsin Rapids
description: Here's what you need to know ahead of the Chick-fil-A Tri-State Food Truck's Aug. 14 stop in Wisconsin Rapids.
content:
WISCONSIN RAPIDS – Your Chick-fil-A favorites will be returning to Wisconsin Rapids this week.

The Chick-fil-A Tri-State Food Truck announced on its Facebook page it will serve its menu from 11 a.m. to 6 p.m. Aug. 14 at the South Wood County YMCA, 601 W. Grand Ave.

The truck first began rolling through the tri-state area between Iowa, Minnesota and Wisconsin in 2023, offering a select Chick-fil-A menu to communities without a Chick-fil-A restaurant nearby. The truck has stopped in Wisconsin Rapids a handful of times since June 2024, most recently June 6.

The food truck’s Chick-fil-A menu features a Chick-fil-A chicken sandwich, spicy chicken sandwich, a Chick-fil-A cool wrap and a grilled cobb salad. Chick-fil-A nuggets come in eight, 12 or 30 pieces, as well.

Sides include waffle potato fries, waffle potato chips, a chocolate chunk cookie and a chocolate fudge brownie. Those who love the Chick-fil-A sauce can also purchase a bottle of it.

The chicken sandwiches, wrap and nuggets can be made into a meal to include waffle potato fries and a beverage.

How does it work?

As guest arrive at the YMCA parking lot, they line up at one trailer and place their orders. A second trailer fills orders and will call out names when orders are ready to be picked up.

To follow the truck’s schedule, find the Chick-fil-A Tri-State Food Truck on Facebook.

Contact Caitlin at cshuda@gannett.com or follow her on Twitter @CaitlinShuda.

This article originally appeared on Wisconsin Rapids Daily Tribune: Chick-fil-A Tri-State Food Truck returns to Wisconsin Rapids
summary: The Chick-fil-A Tri-State Food Truck is returning to Wisconsin Rapids, offering its menu from 11 a.m. to 6 p.m., starting from the South Wood County YMCA on August 14. The truck has been operating in the tri-state area since 2023 offering a select Chick-fl-A menu without a nearby restaurant. The menu includes a Chick-inspired chicken sandwich, spicy chicken sandwich and a grilled cobb salad. The sides include waffle potato fries, waffle potatoes, a chocolate chunk cookie and a chocolate fudge brownie.
shortSummary: The Chick-fil-A Tri-State Food Truck will serve its menu at the South Wood County YMCA on Aug. 14, offering sandwiches, wraps, and nuggets.

scraped_sources.text:
Craving Chick-fil-A? You can find the Tri-State Food Truck Aug. 14 in Wisconsin Rapids
Here's what you need to know ahead of the Chick-fil-A Tri-State Food Truck's Aug. 14 stop in Wisconsin Rapids.
WISCONSIN RAPIDS – Your Chick-fil-A favorites will be returning to Wisconsin Rapids this week.
The Chick-fil-A Tri-State Food Truck announced on its Facebook page it will serve its menu from 11 a.m. to 6 p.m. Aug. 14 at the South Wood County YMCA, 601 W. Grand Ave.
The truck first began rolling through the tri-state area between Iowa, Minnesota and Wisconsin in 2023, offering a select Chick-fil-A menu to communities without a Chick-fil-A restaurant nearby. The truck has stopped in Wisconsin Rapids a handful of times since June 2024, most recently June 6.
What’s on the menu?
The food truck’s Chick-fil-A menu features a Chick-fil-A chicken sandwich, spicy chicken sandwich, a Chick-fil-A cool wrap and a grilled cobb salad. Chick-fil-A nuggets come in eight, 12 or 30 pieces, as well.
Sides include waffle potato fries, waffle potato chips, a chocolate chunk cookie and a chocolate fudge brownie. Those who love the Chick-fil-A sauce can also purchase a bottle of it.
Beverages include bottled water, Coke, Diet Coke, Sprite, Chick-fil-A lemonade and Chick-fil-A sweet tea.
The chicken sandwiches, wrap and nuggets can be made into a meal to include waffle potato fries and a beverage.
How does it work?
As guest arrive at the YMCA parking lot, they line up at one trailer and place their orders. A second trailer fills orders and will call out names when orders are ready to be picked up.
To follow the truck’s schedule, find the Chick-fil-A Tri-State Food Truck on Facebook.
Contact Caitlin at cshuda@gannett.com or follow her on Twitter @CaitlinShuda.

argos_summary: The Chick-fil-A Tri-State Food Truck will be in Wisconsin Rapids on August 14, serving its menu from 11 a.m. to 6 p.m. at the South Wood County YMCA. The truck offers a selection of Chick-fil-A favorites, including chicken sandwiches, nuggets, and sides like waffle fries and cookies. Customers can place orders at one trailer while another trailer prepares the food for pickup.
